SENT.plain: Cortical infarction presenting with pure dysarthria is rarely reported
Previous studies have reported pure dysarthria due to cortical stroke at the precentral gyrus or middle frontal gyrus
We report a 72-year-old man who developed pure dysarthria caused by an acute cortical infarction in the insular cortex
The role of the insula in language has been difficult to assess clinically because of the rarity of pure insular strokes
Our patient showed pure dysarthria without aphasia, indicating that pure dysarthria can be the sole manifestation of insular infarctions
